activity_evidence.activity: Confirm and map the sites to implement the digital infrastructure in 35 locations of Côte d’Ivoire.
activity_evidence.challenge: Mairie d'Abobo has not yet submitted the Mayor-signed confirmation letter; although a room is allocated, the absence of formal documentation delays final confirmation.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Maintain close follow-up with the Deputy General Secretary; conduct January 2026 visit; prioritize centers with complete documentation while engaging Abobo to achieve 100% site confirmation.

activity_evidence.activity: Develop comprehensive designs for the GENIE Centers, including renovation plans, equipment specifications, internet connectivity, and operational structure.
activity_evidence.challenge: Mairie de Grand Bassam changed the designated site in December 2025, rendering the existing design plan obsolete.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Schedule a January 2026 field visit; conduct fresh technical assessments; develop and approve an updated design and transmit to the contractor for integration.

activity_evidence.activity: Define and formalize governance agreements with universities and Mairies to host the GENIE Centers.
activity_evidence.challenge: Mairie d'Abobo’s Mayor has not signed the official confirmation letter; municipal signature is a critical dependency for proceeding with renovation, furniture, and equipment installation.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Sustain diplomatic engagement; January 2026 visit to meet municipal leadership and facilitate submission of the Mayor-signed letter for Phase II rollout integration.

activity_evidence.activity: Roll out the implementation of the GENIE Centers in 35 locations.
activity_evidence.challenge: Cascading procurement delays (late FA/sub-orders, separate ICT contracts), furniture production and customs issues, and site-specific scope expansion caused 10–12 month delays for Phase I/II with sequential dependency bottlenecks.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Adaptive timeline management and phased activation; front-loaded assessments; accelerated Phase II mobilization; parallel multi-site execution; improved customs documentation; technical specs optimization.

activity_evidence.activity: Develop and integrate Green Practices curriculum into the ToT program.
activity_evidence.challenge: FJN withdrawal (December 2024) delayed initiation by 3–4 months and compressed the development window.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Expedited onboarding of Impact Lab; parallel development streams; compressed Apr–Aug 2025 delivery with full LMS integration.

activity_evidence.activity: Recruit the trainers from the selected host locations of the GENIE Centers to participate in the ToT program.
activity_evidence.challenge: 3 trainers from Mairie de Tréichville remain unconfirmed, preventing 100% recruitment.
activity_evidence.counterplan: January 2026 site visit to finalize trainer identification and recruitment to complete the 105-trainer target in Q1 2026.

activity_evidence.activity: Train the trainers (teachers) from the selected host locations of the GENIE Centers.
activity_evidence.challenge: 16-trainer gap between Green vs. ICT pedagogy; 81 trainers have not completed online modules; 3 trainers unrecruited.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Conduct February 2026 catch-up ToT for 16 trainers; implement structured online completion monitoring for 81 trainers; prioritize Phase II trainer follow-up to finish online content before equipment installation.

activity_evidence.activity: Identify the students from middle school, high school, and TVET centers to participate in the training program at GENIE Centers.
activity_evidence.challenge: Interdependent delays in infrastructure and ToT prevented 2025 enrollment; strict sequential prerequisites blocked training cycles.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Launch Q1 2026 enrollment (Bondoukou call; LPIA Treichville pilot); implement an offline transitional option; synchronize Phase II student identification with the final stages of trainer certification.

activity_evidence.activity: Deliver the training to the students and assess their performance.
activity_evidence.challenge: Sequential delays left 2025 without live cohort baselines for performance/quality metrics.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Prioritize Q1 2026 data collection from initial cohorts; use LMS analytics for real-time pass-rate monitoring; apply QA feedback to refine trainer handbooks before Phase II scale.

activity_evidence.activity: Organize the Training of Trainers program for advanced trainers (Application Master + Green Business).
activity_evidence.challenge: Recruitment and certification delays: only 8/19 completed online modules; 11 pending recruitment due to center readiness; in-person ToT scheduled for February 2026.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Phased recruitment and training (4 in Jan–Feb; 6 in Apr–Jun 2026); in-person sessions in Feb and Jun–Jul 2026 to reach 19 fully certified trainers.

activity_evidence.activity: Train the university students through the ICT Academy program with Green Business Fundamentals.
activity_evidence.challenge: Limited trainer availability constrained enrollment; uneven mastery in Green Technologies/Business; iOS practicals blocked by hardware; coding prerequisite excludes non-dev profiles.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Phased enrollment expansion starting Jan 2026; strengthened sustainability modules with practical/context-based learning and expert workshops; iOS conceptual via LMS with Android practicals; introduce optional low-code track.

activity_evidence.activity: Select Greenpreneurs through a call for applications.
activity_evidence.challenge: Low regional application volumes (42 from three cities vs 120 in Abidjan) due to limited awareness and compressed outreach.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Enhanced 2026 regional outreach: early January RFP; localized activities; simplified application; virtual info sessions; target balanced distribution.

activity_evidence.activity: Develop and host the Greenpreneur training modules in the GENIE Centers.
activity_evidence.challenge: Compressed development timeline due to partner transition (FJN to Impact Lab), limiting pilot testing before deployment.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Parallelized curriculum development, rapid prototypes with feedback, and continuous improvement during implementation.

activity_evidence.activity: Recruit mentors to pair Greenpreneurs with professionals to provide guidance.
activity_evidence.challenge: Mentor recruitment timeline compressed to Jan 2026 (4–6 weeks) due to cohort and pitch delays.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Accelerated mentor RFP (Jan 17, 2026), streamlined evaluation, virtual briefings; in future, run procurement in parallel with training.

activity_evidence.activity: Promote and manage the Greenpreneur incubation program in partnership with the Ivorian government.
activity_evidence.challenge: Limited promotional activities (8/15) due to compressed timeline; reduced early-year awareness and regional outreach.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Expanded 2026 campaign launched January: monthly webinars, center outreaches, media, and partnerships to exceed 15 activities.

activity_evidence.activity: Organize in-person Greenpreneur focus groups/cohorts in GENIE Centers.
activity_evidence.challenge: Participant shortfall from delayed center availability; inconsistent enforcement of 80% attendance threshold undermined rigor.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Accelerate 2026 with 3 cohorts (target 264); hybrid delivery; automate attendance tracking and enforce certification criteria.

activity_evidence.activity: Deliver mentorship seminars for Greenpreneurs.
activity_evidence.challenge: Mentorship delayed to Q1 2026 due to training completion and election-period uncertainties.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Mentor RFP Jan 17; finalists Jan 30; mentorship Feb 1–21; align with late-Feb pitch competition.

activity_evidence.activity: Organize networking events for Greenpreneurs.
activity_evidence.challenge: Online-only events limited face-to-face relationship building and spontaneous connections.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Adopt hybrid events in 2026: continue online sessions for inclusion; add quarterly in-person center events and leverage ceremonies/pitch days.

activity_evidence.activity: Conduct a pitch competition to link startups to the Greenpreneur Fund or other early-stage funding.
activity_evidence.challenge: Competition delayed from Q4 2025 to Q1 2026 due to training and election-period disruptions.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Run late-Feb 2026 competition following the three-week mentorship; in future, align competition schedule with earlier training launches.

activity_evidence.activity: Identify a network of early-stage funders and venture capital institutions.
activity_evidence.challenge: Near-term commitments limited; most funders await market-ready pipeline and pitch outcomes.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Stage engagement: invite to Feb 2026 pitch; Q2–Q3 due diligence; maintain monthly investor updates.

activity_evidence.activity: Establish GGGI Greenpreneur Fund of USD 300,000 to provide seed capital to winners.
activity_evidence.challenge: Fund not yet established in 2025; pitch competition delayed—no 2025 disbursement.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Finalize fund structure in Q1 2026; disburse USD 100,000 to 5 winners in March 2026; maintain governance and reporting protocols.

activity_evidence.activity: Conduct a policy review of the framework and incentives to sustain the Greenpreneur program.
activity_evidence.challenge: Consultant procurement delays shifted studies to 2026 data collection; final reports slipped beyond 2025.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Accelerate Q1 2026 fieldwork and deliver validated final reports by May 2026.

activity_evidence.activity: Organize a Green Leadership Academy for sustainability of the Greenpreneur program.
activity_evidence.challenge: Program launch delayed to 2026 to align with partner availability and academic calendars.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Run Cohort 1 Jan 29–Apr 3, 2026 with confirmed speakers and venues; subsequent cohorts scheduled through 2027.

activity_evidence.activity: Organize a study tour in GGGI Greenpreneurship network countries.
activity_evidence.challenge: Study tour delayed due to pitch postponement and election-period availability of officials.
activity_evidence.counterplan: Schedule first tour for late March 2026 (10 participants) and finalize logistics; second tour in 2027.
